column4: Can anyone help me out, my filesystem won't mount, I booted to LiveCD, tried check/repair it is returning "The filesystem is NOT clean"
which FS do you use?
Ext3
do you literally mean the filesystem or messed up files on top?
use fsck from the terminal and post the output
What is the command? I mean, I know fsck...but what options do I need?
I am getting Device or resource busy...but I don't have the drive mounted...do I need to manually umount it first or something? \
I don't think you have the filesystem directly on sdb but more likely on sdb1, check dmesg|grep sdb
sudo fsck.ext3 /dev/sda2 or similar?
sudo fsck /dev/sdb
It looks like it is sdb...there is a an [sbd] tag on the largest size block
post output of sudo fdisk -l /dev/sdb
K...will be a sec, need to get it on the internets...
I apologize...you were right...it was sdb1 I am running the fsck now...
np
fsck to the rescue...ty for the help!
nice to hear that
Can you give me a short version of why that would have happened? just in abstract...

fdisk would look at /dev/sdb which has a mbr "header" instead of a valid ext3 header, instead of properly failing and telling you: "no ext3 FS found on /dev/sdb" it gave you that misleading error code (well that's how I understand it anway)
Sorry, my fault for being a little unclear, what would cause the file system to fail?
Oh many reasons, often it's hardware related, bad RAM, bad PSU, bad HDD, system crash, but software bugs could corrupt the FS as well.
Ok, fair enough..I'll settle for it being fixed...thanks again...take care...
